Description: Flight into Egypt: landscape with, in the centre, St Joseph leading the donkey on a stone footbridge crossing a small stream; behind him, on the left Virgin carrying sleeping Child Etching
Curator's comments: Dated between 1658 and 1665 in cat. exhib. 'Sébastien Bourdon' (Paris, 2000), No.265.
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Baptist (Prodromos)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Richard Grenville, 1st Duke of Buckingham and Chandos
Acquisition notes: The varied and important prints inventoried as 1834,0804.1 to 356 were all purchased by Ottley in the third part of the Stowe sale, beginning on 14 July 1834. He bought 50 lots which cost the BM a total of £93 4s. His purchases were also listed in the 1837 inventory under the numbers Kk,7.1 to 277 and Kk,8.1 to 78. The order of the inventory listing does not follow that of the 1834,0804 register. The records have been edited to make the 1834,0804 number the prime number, and the Kk,7 8 numbers have been recorded as additional numbers. (AVG 2019)
